Upcoming Events

The team is involved in a range of activities across the University and its partners, including community meetups, training courses and workshops.

Version Control with Git

21/11/2023
PGR Learning Lab 6.19 HDB

Version control is the lab notebook of the digital world: it's what professionals use to keep track of what they've done and to collaborate with other people. Every large software development project relies on it, and most programmers use it for their small jobs as well. And it isn't just for software: books, papers, small data sets, and anything that changes over time or needs to be shared can and should be stored in a version control system.

More

Training Workshop

Internet of Things (IoT) Workshop

28/11/2023
Room TLC205 Teaching and Learning Centre Durham University

This is a hands-on workshop for novices, aiming to give learners a better understanding of what The Internet of Things is. As a researcher you might be interested to know whether IoT is something that could be of benefit to you in your research and we hope that this workshop might help you answer that question.
